title: Healthcare Costs in Guam
content:
The cost of healthcare in Guam can vary greatly depending on the type of care and whether you are using public or private facilities, with a typical doctor's visit costing between $50 and $200.

[FACTBOX]
Health Expenditure per Capita: $2,441 (World Bank figure)
Out-of-Pocket Spend: 14.1% (World Bank figure)
Healthcare System: Mixed
Emergency Number: 911
Insurance Required: Recommended
Currency: USD
[/FACTBOX]

[SECTION] Healthcare System Overview [/SECTION]
Guam's healthcare system is a mix of public and private facilities, with the Guam Memorial Hospital being the only public hospital on the island. The public healthcare system is generally considered to be of lower quality compared to the private system, but it is still accessible to locals and foreigners alike. However, the public system often has long wait times and limited resources, making private healthcare a more attractive option for those who can afford it. For locals, the public healthcare system is often the primary option, while foreigners may prefer to use private facilities, which offer higher quality care but at a higher cost.

The healthcare system in Guam works differently for locals and foreigners, with locals being eligible for government-funded healthcare programs, while foreigners are typically required to have private insurance to cover their medical expenses. It is highly recommended that foreigners have insurance to cover their medical expenses, as the cost of healthcare in Guam can be very high. Many private insurance plans are available, offering a range of coverage options, from basic to comprehensive. It's essential to research and choose a plan that suits your needs and budget.

[TABLE]

[SECTION] Pharmacy & Medication Costs [/SECTION]
- Prescription medication can cost between $10 and $50 per prescription, depending on the type and quantity of medication.
- Over-the-counter medication is widely available at pharmacies and convenience stores, with prices similar to those in the US.
- Some medications may require a prescription from a licensed doctor in Guam, while others can be purchased over-the-counter.
- Pharmacies are widely available in Guam, with many located in shopping centers and near hospitals.
- It's essential to check the prices and availability of medication before purchasing, as they can vary between pharmacies.
- Some pharmacies may offer discounts or loyalty programs, which can help reduce the cost of medication.

[SECTION] Emergency Care [/SECTION]
In the event of a medical emergency, it's essential to call 911 or visit the emergency room at the Guam Memorial Hospital. The hospital has a 24-hour emergency room and provides emergency care to locals and foreigners alike. For foreigners, it's recommended to have private insurance to cover the cost of emergency care, as the cost can be very high. The best hospitals for foreigners in Guam are the Guam Memorial Hospital and the Guam Regional Medical City, which offer high-quality care and have English-speaking staff.

Ambulance services are available in Guam, but they may not be as readily available as in other countries. It's essential to have a plan in place in case of an emergency, including knowing the location of the nearest hospital and having a means of transportation. For foreigners, it's also recommended to research and choose a hospital that has experience in treating foreigners and has a good reputation for providing quality care. By being prepared and having the right insurance coverage, you can ensure that you receive the best possible care in the event of a medical emergency.
